title: Bug 6410: File unchanged but dirtied by code assist
description: Bug 6410: File unchanged but dirtied by code assist
OB: When using the code assist feature in a Java file, the file is marked as 'dirty' even though no changes have been made to the file.
EB: The file should not be marked as 'dirty' when using the code assist feature, as it does not introduce any changes to the file.
SR:
To reproduce: 
1. Open a Java file.
2. Place the cursor inside the leftmost parenthesis of a method call.
3. For example, consider 'I' to be the cursor below:
   Object o = anotherObject.method(I);
4. Press Ctrl+Space to trigger the code assist feature.
